intro: Arctotis auriculata, commonly known as the ear-shaped arctotis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow to orange flower heads with dark centers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a silvery underside, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
